comments:

thrown when I tru to build the my application.
I am using Eclipse 3.1 with JDK 1.5.
It works fine on Eclipse 3.1M6.

I also got the same message trying to deploy the Hex Game from Berthod 
Daum's "Professional Excipse ...", but using the (BEA) JRockit JDK.

The Application is pretty clean (not dependent on any other external plugins) 
as well as pretty small. If anybody is interested, I'm happy to send a zip-
file (6Mb).

The application works OK when run from the development environment.

You should check that all the dependency of your plugins are satisfied.
Try to start with -debug option.

Actually, the problem was a missing:

"osgi.bundles=org.eclipse.core.runtime@2:start, 
org.eclipse.update.configurator@3:start"

line in the "config.ini". This I found out through the newsgroup 
(eclipse.platform.rcp). 

I did create the config.ini from scratch, and thus the line above was missing 
altogether. The default config.ini of the "eclipse-RCP-3.1-win32.zip" contains 
the line

#osgi.bundles=org.eclipse.core.runtime@2:start

But in my case, even if I uncommented that line, it wasn't enough 
("java.lang.RuntimeException: Application "com.bdaum.Hex.RcpApplication" could 
not be found in the registry. The applications available are: <NONE>.
") 

By the way, After adding that I was (of course) missing some plugins i was 
depending on, but in this case, I got a resonable (though not prefect) error 
message (see below).
